sub_topic: Calculation of Carnot efficiency of a heat engine
message_1: A Carnot engine operates between two reservoirs at temperatures of 400 K and 300 K. The engine absorbs 2000 J of energy from the hotter reservoir and rejects 1200 J of energy to the colder reservoir in one cycle. Calculate the Carnot efficiency of this engine.
message_2:
The Carnot efficiency is given by the formula:

Efficiency = 1 - (Tc/Th)

where Tc is the temperature of the colder reservoir and Th is the temperature of the hotter reservoir. In this case, Tc = 300 K and Th = 400 K.

Efficiency = 1 - (300/400)
Efficiency = 1 - 0.75
Efficiency = 0.25

The Carnot efficiency of this engine is 25%.
